comment: Just avoid plain and simple. Not worth the headache and you'll never get a respectful response for legitimate questions

Try to avoid if at all possible. Spent majority of my free time doing busy work. I also had some pretty serious concerns, that ended up coming true, about my group for the group project and couldn't even get a direct response when I raised them. A side note, none of the busy work prepares you for the final.

I recommend taking another professor for this course if possible.A large amount of busy work - lengthy LearnSmarts, Quizzes, and HW, and discussion posts with too many requirements, the requirement of having to physically visit a factory was unreasonable for an online course.Difficult, over the top final, and she is very slow at grading.Hard pass!

Would take again. Class was not necessarily difficult, but the only complaint is a good amount of busy work. One big group project and Final Exam is worth 30% of the class, but otherwise no complaints.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I enjoyed this class online during Covid. I enjoyed this professor and weekly posts and Connect homework. The group project was fun and not intensive. She gives only one test and reading is a must.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: She never puts grades in. No one in my whole class understood a word she said the entire semester. Never had a more boring professor. Glad this class is over. There is extra credit.

Class was made up of: Learnsmart, Quizzes, 2 exams recorded on Lockdown (40% of your grade), discussions, & a group project. Get the group project done early and take good notes! Exam wording and textbook wording did not match- found exams very difficult. Read the textbook and do all the assignments in Connect because they help your grade the most
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Shes average I guess, not much personality there. Weekly Connect HW, Learnsmart & discussions. Mid term and final - both on lockdown browser recording you. Group project requires you to visit a manufacturing plant and write a report on it, not hard at all with a good group. Short report. Overall, average professor and average class

Mediocre at best. Goes over prepared PPT slides which seems like its been years since she updated it. Attendance is scored, halfway through I gave up and bought the book because it's considerably more clear. She gives study guides and that's how I am making it through; not the worst so if you're deciding on taking her be prepared to teach yourself.

Siha is very nice and quiet. Her class really is not that hard. She is hard to hear unless you sit in the front. Her tests are online and lots of learnsmart and connect. She is so nice I wish she was my grandma

I took her online and I'd never take her again. A dozen group assignments , so if your group isn't great, your grade isn't either. Grading criteria is vague. Quiz every week-- 80% vocabulary& 20% problems. No tests, just final. Final all problems, but nothing in the class prepares you for it. The class is passable, but by no means practical or easy
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS--Tests are tough

comment: Clearly the people grading this professor skipped class. It's an upper level class, so of course it's going to be concept heavy. She was easy to understand and kept lectures interesting. She is very knowledgeable in this course. Do the homework, study the quizlets, get a good group, and you'll be fine.

Horrible. Not even horrible just frustrating because she is foreign so hard to understand. She does not do a good job at teaching. 3 test non cumulative but nothing like the study guides she posts. Only made a B because of all the learnsmarts and easy chapter quizzes/ discussion post made up for every test I failed. Learn on your own but can pass!
Overly harsh in grading even the simplest of tasks, like discussions. This class was mandatory for me and was thoroughly unenjoyable. Positive of the class? It was online.

Find a good group that is willing to work hard. There is a lot of busy work in this class, but having a good group makes it bearable. Discussions are crucial, and she expects you to know exactly what to do. Her e-mail responses are short, and sometimes vague. The book is crucial.

Professor Siha really helped me out this semester.  I had a lot going on and accidentally missed an assignment.  It didn't count for much, but at the end of the semester, it was enough to keep me just under an A.  The professor worked with me and allowed me to make it up.   As long as you do your weekly assignments and discussions, you're fine!

Took online. Class is mostly group-work. Lots of reports to compile.  The final was the only test and nobody had an idea of what to expect outside of a list of chapter headings. The test was extremely long and counted 25%. Most I talked to failed it. Do not recommend this class.

Taking the class online and like her. She is sweet and emails if you miss an assignment explainingsuggesting personally how you could have done it (she knows you). The weekly test answers are all online, but midtermfinal are math-heavy and you won't find answers online. Group project is easy (7 pgs 5 people).  Weekly scheduleemails - it's easy!

This professor is very confusing and extremely dull. The material is dry enough but it's clear that she has no passion for what she does. She has an accent that is hard to understand and assigns a seating chart. If you are assigned to sit in the back good luck hearing her. Online quizzes with infinite attempts. 1 group project. Stay away if you can

Professor Siha wants students to do well, but she is not very helpful.  She does not respond to questions/emails quickly, and is often unclear when she does.  Quizzes are not helpful for anything other than grades, tests are moderately difficult, but doable if you study.  Not my favorite professor, but not the worst, either.

She is very LAZY! Does not teach at all. She takes days to respond to emails and to grade. I'm graduating in a few hours and shes does not have our grades posted yet. There is LOT work and group work in this class. Mostly easy things but still it takes time. Make sure you pick a good group. Quizzes are overall easy, but the final was hard.

She is overall a nice instructor to talk to, other than that there wasn't much positive about the course. Her teaching style is dull and repetitive, you'll feel completely unprepared for the exams (which are ridiculously hard).  She's not a malicious instructor, she just makes the course about 10 times harder than it needs to be.
Worst professor I've had at. She is very unclear and has a horrible teaching method, not to mention she's very annoying. Avoid if possible!

Siha is easily the worst professor I've had while at KSU. She's nice, but being nice isn't everything. She teaches in the most heinously boring manner possible. I gave up listening to her and just studied the material myself before an exam. How she still has a position at this school with her teaching method is beyond me.

The class is insanely boring. Professor is a little difficult to understand. Online quizzes every week. Attendance gives you a chance to skip the final. Go to class, but bring something to do or an energy drink.

Took online and didn't have any interest in it. It was one of the few electives that were offered online so I had no choice. This class requires a lot of group work for the weekly assignments and group project at the end. The material for this class is basically chart after chart and diagram after diagram. Get in a good group and you should do well

I took the class online. It is a lot of work. The book is not an option. I suggest you buy it before the semester starts. It is easy to fall behind on assignments. There is a group project so choose your group members wisely. You must recall a lil bit of statistics to take this class.The online class was good 4 me. People say she is boring in class
She is a great professor! Very sweet and a great person. Her class is do-able.

This was an Online Class. % Break down is as follows: Weekly Quizes 20% Weekly Discussions20%, 6 group assignments 20% Group Project 15% and Final Exam 25%  Tips: Don't pick team members last minute. Chances are you will get the lack luster of the lot.  Overall The class is do-able and an A is possible.

Coming into this class I had 26 A's and 6 B's as an Accounting major.  I am pretty sure I am going to make a C in the class because she lulls you to sleep with two super easy tests, and then murders you with and impossible final.  The material is the most dry, heinous material possible.  She is nice, but that doesn't go far enough.

Do not take from her! She is a sweet lady, but she made me want to fall asleep every time she talked. To be honest, I really don't think i learned anything from her. one of the worst classes i have taken at Ksu. I am a senior so maybe that should say something. just fair warning avoid at all cost!

Her class is EXTREMELY boring. Her lectures have nothing to do with the tests. I studied the online quizzes that are due before each class and made a C on the first test, and an A on the last two. I would have had an A in the class if I got the attendance poitns. Also, there's a really easy group project.

Dr. Siha is very dry, very boring. But honestly it's not her fault, the subject she teaches is just god awful. I really feel sorry for her. Everyone hates Operations Management, so just put your head down and do it. Avoid Siha if you can, but it really doesn't matter. No matter who you take its gonna suck.

I took this class online and don't recommend it at all. A lot of work, weekly discussions and quizzes as well as a group assignment due almost every week and a term project also. If you do take this class, pick your group members carefully!!

First of all this was the worst class I have ever taken on online. Mgt 3200 has alot of mathematical concepts that should only be taught in the classroom. This prof. was the hardest and worst for this course. Dont take her. You've  now been warned.

I had looked forward to taking this elective; however, this class has been the most useless course I have taken in my college career. The text book absolutely sucks (978-0-07-337783-4) and the professor grades ridiculously and has a difficult time explaining things, which leads to much confusion. Steer clear!!!
Horrible professor. Very dry, boring lectures that you want to fall asleep in. Lets you use note card for test, but test are not that easy. Bring a pillow to class!

She gave us the review sheets for the tests, and the reviews have everything that is on the test.  She also allowed us to have 1 sheet of paper to use during the test.  So if you did the review and used that as your 1 sheet, it was a very very easy class.  She does take attendance and it might affect your grade at the end.

took this class online, the quizzes do not match the answers to the quizes are somewhat unclar and confusing. She makes no effort to make the necessary correction unless you mistyped something. Very boring and too much work becuase if you e-mail her for help it takes forever for her to respond that you nolonger need her help.
Best online course!!! Use book on all weekly quizes. Do  discussion question and weekly group assignment which is easily split up within the group you will do great. EASY A!!!

If you can take this course online defiantly do so.  There are group work, weekly assignments, discussions, and quizzes.  There is a cumulative final that has to be taken on campus though.  The prof is usually helpful if you go to her.. if fact she did extend some deadlines.
Creates good material but then reads from the material. Seemed disorganized because of shortended semester.

Best online course ever.  Email professor with questions on assignments and she'll explain everything.  Its online, so use your book on tests!!!  Just make sure you contribute to the discussions (two per week) and you'll do fine.  If one of your group members is a slacker it can make it a little harder, but the professor is very understanding.
took her online.  material and quizzes don't match up for the most part.  Assignment were difficult.  would not take her again if I had a choice.
Why is she still teaching?  Very smart but very unclear - tests don't match lectures or book at all
